article:
In health care, 'isolation' refers to various measures taken to prevent
contagious diseases from being spread from a patient to other patients, health
care workers, and visitors, or from others to a particular patient. Various
forms of isolation exist, some of which contact procedures are modified, and
others in which the patient is kept away from all others.

Isolation is most commonly used when a patient has a viral illness. Special equipment is used in the treatment of
patients on the various forms of isolation. These most commonly include gowns,
masks, and gloves.
